result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antione Desha Hervey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antione Desha Hervey in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders case DISMISSED but read-in to 14CM3836as to sentencing.
Status conference scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Antione Desha Hervey
Current: 7128 West Medford Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 05-07-2015)
Prior: 7128 West Medford Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Larry F. and Ladonna F. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.46  for a Status Conference.vb

Defendant Antione Desha Hervey in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
